title: Your Friday Briefing: Covid Protests Grow in China
description: Plus Malaysia’s new prime minister and the week in culture.

title: He’s a Paralympian, a Surgeon and Now the First Disabled Astronaut
description: John McFall, who lost a leg in a motorcycle accident when he was a teenager, was recruited by the European Space Agency and could soon be headed for space.

title: Lawmakers Back Bill to Enshrine Abortion Rights in France’s Constitution
description: The bill, which developed in response to the U.S. Supreme Court’s overturning of Roe v. Wade, may face opposition in France’s Senate and would have to be approved in a referendum.

title: Under Missile Strikes, Ukrainians Haul Water, While Surgeons Work in the Dark
description: “Every hour is getting harder.” Russia’s assault on Ukraine’s essential services has caused blackouts in hospitals and cut off power and water in cities.

title: Parent Company of Yandex, Known as ‘Russia’s Google,’ Wants to Cut Ties With Country
description: The move would be a setback to President Vladimir V. Putin’s efforts to develop homegrown substitutes for Western technology.

title: Surgeons in Ukraine Struggle to Operate When the Power Goes Out
description: The scene in a Kyiv hospital was a vivid illustration of the cascading toll Russia’s attacks are having on civilians far from the front lines.

title: Ukraine Scrambles to Restore Services After Disruptive Russian Strikes
description: Surgeons worked by flashlight, miners were pulled from deep underground and people across Ukraine lugged buckets of water up flights of stairs.

title: Indonesia Earthquake Takes a Heavy Toll on Children
description: Children accounted for a third of the at least 272 dead when an earthquake hit Indonesia this week. Experts say the disaster highlights poor building standards in rural areas.

title: iPhone Factory Protest Challenges China’s ‘Zero Covid’ Rules
description: Protests are rising as China enacts more lockdowns and quarantines, with no end in sight. The defiance is a test of Xi Jinping’s authoritarian leadership.

title: Happy Thanksgiving
description: Everything is going to turn out all right today.

title: Russian Missile Strikes Maternity Ward, Killing Newborn, Ukraine Says
description: “Grief fills our hearts,” a regional official said.

title: Manx Language Is Experiencing a Revival on the Isle of Man
description: After being on the brink of extinction, the ancient tongue is experiencing a revival on the Isle of Man, thanks in part to an elementary school and some impassioned parents.

title: Meet the World’s New Human Rights Crisis Manager. He Has a Lot to Do.
description: From Somalia to Ukraine to Xinjiang in China, Volker Türk will have no shortage of challenges as he steps into one of the United Nations’ most delicate roles.

title: Ending Days of Political Gridlock, Malaysia’s King Appoints a Prime Minister
description: Before Anwar Ibrahim’s selection, the country had been contending with its first hung Parliament after Saturday’s election.

title: Pakistan Names a New Army Chief, Amid Political Drama Centered on the Military
description: The appointment of Lt. Gen. Syed Asim Munir comes after weeks of intense speculation and backstage negotiations over who would lead the nuclear-armed military.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Heavy Russian strikes on infrastructure targets in Ukraine.

title: A US-Made Missile Went Astray in Ukraine, Injuring Civilians
description: An air-launched AGM-88B missile, built to destroy enemy radars, apparently missed its target and hit an apartment building in Kramatorsk in September.

title: Russian Missile Barrage Cuts Power and Water Across Ukraine
description: Outages struck Kyiv and the surrounding region, as well as Lviv, Dnipro, Odesa and Kharkiv. Half of Moldova, whose grid is tied to Ukraine’s, also lost power.
